project.teaser: While the high influx of asylum seekers poses an enormous pressure on the host countries (nearly 3.8 million new asylum applications recorded in Europe in the years 2015-2017), studies of previous large-scale migration movements reveal insights into positive effects of...
project.objective: While the high influx of asylum seekers poses an enormous pressure on the host countries (nearly 3.8 million new asylum applications recorded in Europe in the years 2015-2017), studies of previous large-scale migration movements reveal insights into positive effects of welcoming refugees and significant economic returns of investments into refugees. Although exact figures are missing, there is some evidence indicating that a significant part of the refugees is highly skilled. This suggests that a substantial number of refugees could potentially contribute to the European Research Area as well as the economies and societies of their host countries and the European Union (EU). It is therefore of utmost importance to provide the job seekers with coordinated and needs-based support in job search and match making with the employers seeking work force of their competence and expertise. The CARe project (Career Advancement for Refugee Researchers in Europe) is a 21-month project that aims to support the labour market integration of refugee researchers through coordinated and tailored provision of information needed for their entry and integration in R&D market. It targets 10 European countries with high numbers of asylum seekers, the absorption capacity of the R&D labour market and proven political will to support the labour market integration of refugee researchers (Austria, Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland and the Netherlands). The project objectives will be achieved through a set of research and dissemination activities that will on the one hand, provide needs-based and country-specific information on the labour market conditions and requirements for refugee researchers, and on the other, provide Europe-wide platforms for results dissemination and exploitation on a much larger scale by involving EURAXESS centres and dissemination through the EURAXESS portal.
project.title: Career Advancement for Refugee Researchers in Europe

article.title: Labour market integration of researchers with refugee background

category.description: Article: description of linked project written by editorial team

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - CARe (Career Advancement for Refugee Researchers in Europe)
result.teaser: The CARe project (Career Advancement for Refugee Researchers in Europe) was a 24-month Horizon 2020 funded project. Its aim was to support the labour market integration of researchers with refugee background through coordinated & tailored provision of information needed for...

result.description: Summary of the main findings and insights from the survey conducted with employer groups in the target countries.

result.description: A LinkedIn group established after the focus groups to enable networking and exchange of experts with refugee background as well as to increase their visibility among potential employers.

result.title: 4.1 Country guides
result.description: Country fiches with the relevant information needed to guide refugee researchers in the 10 target countries on the labour market specificities, requirements and needs.

result.title: 5.1 1 EU/10 country webinars
result.description: One EU and 10 country-specific webinars for the target group, featuring representatives of the research labour market - from academia to industry and non-profits.

result.title: report on recruiting ACO's
result.description: Task 541 Developing tools and methodologies to successfully recruit ACOs to enter renovation processes differentiated according to the subtarget groupTask 542 Developing the ideal formula to provide advice for an apartment building taking into account the recurring topics pertaining specifically to the building structure and sensitive aspects of the coownership situation Not only technical recommendations but also adequate cost estimates are essential We can offer such adequate cost estimates because of our intensive collaboration with the construction sector WP 6Task 543 Developing the most suitable way to orally explain the advice to ACOs taking into account the various previously defined subtarget groupsTranslating the jargon of the total cost estimate of the works to be carried out into a language that is comprehensible to a layman ie into cost per monthper ownerConverting a report intended for specialists into a convincing narrative that correctly informs provides readymade solutions and therefore unburdens the coowners

result.title: Report containing description of the adjusted financial service all target groups
result.description: Identify problem areas andor opportunities in the customer journey and identify where and how financial service can be improved to promote energy renovation Various elements can be addressed in this regardcredit characteristics eg Differentiate the duration or the interest rate in terms of the renovation Grant payment deferment as long as the home is uninhabitable due to the renovation Cost differentiation eg not charging estimation costs or administration costs if renovation advice is provided to encourage the customerAdapt the rules in respect of credit acceptance Eg by not providing purchase financing for housing that is to be renovated without a renovation plan taking into account lower energy costs in the budget analysis etcEstablish a guarantee systematically increase the amount of the registered mortgage facilitating subsequently mortgage loans for renovation without a public notaryPropose combinations eg a mortgage loan combined with a soft loan 2 mortgage loans combined under 1 guarantee etcOptimise credit processes both when applying for credit eg coordinate the deployment of an assessor with that of an energy adviser and when releasing the funds intended for the renovation eg release only after submitting reports by the energy adviser on proper execution of the renovationDevelop a prototypepreliminary tools to eliminate problem areas andor exploit opportunities

project.title: Creation of a holistic methodology for REnovation Advice with focus on Lending solutions differentiated by target group.

result.title: Report describing the developed methodology all target groups
result.description: Identify problem areas andor opportunities in the customer journey and check where and how collaboration between adviser and financier can generate added valueGenerate input from expert groupOrganise a workshop with credit advisers and energy advisers which may be supplemented with members of the expert groupDevelop a prototype to eliminate problem areas andor exploit opportunities draw up planning schedules and organize people infrastructure communication and material components of the service by means of structural cooperation between lender energy adviser and construction professional which may be differentiated for subgroupspersonae

result.title: Communication plan
result.description: A general communication strategy will provide the basis for future project communication both on and offlineA project website is set up and will be managed and completed over the course of the project with general project results and deliverables aimed at specific target groups As it is an important platform for dissemination the website is carefully maintained and updated after the projects runtimeA template for the electronic newsletter is developed Electronic newsletters will be produced at least twice a year a min total of 8 editions to regularly disseminate the projects results to the general public and to target audienceSocial media campaigning is initiated creating profiles on LinkedIn and Facebook and media relations are set up aiming to reach out to the general publicOther supporting promotional materials eg logo rollup project brochure are developedMarketing departments of stakeholders eg municipalities Building Confederation are contacted in their role as multipliers

result.title: 2nd Report on TPF studies and materials properties
result.description: The 2nd and last report on thermoplastic forming (TPF) studies and materials properties consists of a summary of the study of the TPF ability using amorphous samples in form of powders, as-cast and additive manufactured samples.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europeâ€™s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as â€˜Digital transitionâ€™).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europeâ€™s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europeâ€™s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europeâ€™s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europeâ€™s financial contribution to Europeâ€™s biodiversityâ€™s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: 2nd Report on alloying technology development
result.description: The 2nd and final report of alloying technology development describes (i) the finally optimized processing techniques developed at the laboratory-scale for the preparation of master alloys (pre-alloying), amorphous melt-spun ribbons, and as-cast bulk metallic glasses, and (ii) the results of the study of the influence of raw elements purity for the preparation of the materials listed in point (i).

result.title: 1st Report of electromagnetic properties of developed alloys, including magnetic properties vs. processing method assessment
result.description: The 1st report on electromagnetic properties of first year developed alloys describes i the results of electrical resistivity properties of powders meltspun ribbons ascast specimens and additive manufactured specimens ii the results of measurements of the basic and advanced magnetic parameters of the same materials listed in part i and iii a first evaluation of magnetic properties versus alloy variation versus processing method
